thread.title_full: Shannon Noll s ultimate on-stage prank police Yahoo7 Be - Yahoo7

author: Aletha Wilkinson
title: Shannon Noll s ultimate on-stage prank police Yahoo7 Be - Yahoo7
text:
Share Shannon Noll s ultimate on-stage prank police Yahoo7 Be - Yahoo7 
Shannon Noll's recent run-in with the law saw him hit the headlines for all the wrong reasons – getting arrested outside an Adelaide strip club wasn't exactly good for his family-man reputation. Close Shannon Noll's ultimate on-stage prank UP NEXT VIDEO He was dragged off by two female police officers. Source: Facebook/Shannon Noll Shannon Noll's ultimate on-stage prank 
But he managed to find the funny side this week when he organised for a pair of real-life policewomen to drag him off stage at the end of his set at Queensland's Sandstone Point. Yes, those are actual cops. Source: Facebook 
“Not much I can say about that one,” Noll said into the camera once he was safely off stage. “Lucky this one was just a joke though.” 
The stunt took place just one day after Noll failed to attend a court hearing over his embarrassing arrest. Keep smiling, Nollsy. Source: Getty 
Last month, shock jock Kyle Sandilands played his own prank on the singer. 
The 45-year-old radio star directly called 41-year-old Shannon's personal number on Monday morning, and left a cheeky voicemail in which he pretended to be a stripper from the South Australian joint. 
"Hey Nollsie, it's Bambi from the strip club in Adelaide. Darl you never settled your lap dance account so if you could just give us a call down here at Crazy Horse Adelaide, you know the number Nollsie," Kyle began. Radio star Kyle Sandilands prank called Shannon Noll following his arrest. Source: Getty Shannon Noll was arrested outside an Adelaide strip club. Source: Getty 
"I need a card or something to swipe it on. I know normally you'd like to give cash but we need a card or something over the phone. OK darl, can't wait to see you next time." 
Then for humorous effect, Kyle sang the chorus of Rihanna's song 'Shut Up And Drive', instead of Shannon's track 'Drive'. 
Shannon did not attend his court date yesterday. 
He was charged with two counts of assault following an altercation outside Crazy Horse strip club. Footage of the incident emerged. Source: Supplied 
The alleged incident took place on Hindley Street in the South Australian capital after Shannon was refused entry into the well-known venue.
